meanings.definition: A hormone that stimulates the production of T-cells in the immune system.
meanings.sent1: Thymosin helps the body make soldiers to fight germs.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study thymosin to understand how to boost immunity.
meanings.sent3: The T-cells were so excited by thymosin, they threw a party in the immune system.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against illness, thymosin acts as a commander, rallying the troops.
meanings.sent5: Imagine thymosin as a superhero, empowering the immune system to protect the body.

meanings.definition: A peptide that plays a role in cell growth and differentiation.
meanings.sent1: Cells rely on thymosin to grow and specialize.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching how thymosin influences cell development.
meanings.sent3: The cells had a dance-off to see who responds best to thymosin's instructions.
meanings.sent4: Thymosin is like a conductor orchestrating the growth symphony of cells.
meanings.sent5: Picture thymosin as a gardener, nurturing cells to bloom into their specific roles.
